name: BOEING 747SP STILL FLYING IN 2022! Montreal Mirabel Airport Plane Spotting [4K]
description:
Montreal Mirabel International Airport, located north of Montreal, was originally built to replace Dorval Airport as the main airport of Montreal. 

Passenger service to Mirabel ultimately didn't stick around for a variety of reasons, but the airport now serves as a busy cargo hub for Montreal, as well as a base for Nolinor Aviation, Pratt & Whitney Canada, and Airbus.

There's a surprising amount of interesting aircraft to see here, as I found out during this visit for the Pratt & Whitney Canada 747SP back in May!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
00:00 - Pratt & Whitney Canada Boeing 747SP to Marana (MZJ)
03:17 - Cargojet 767-300F from Cincinnati (CVG)
04:06 - Cargojet 767-300F to East Midlands (EMA)
06:05 - Nolinor Aviation 737-200 to Val-d'Or (YVO)
07:40 - Nolinor Aviation Learjet 45 to Holguin (HOG)
08:44 - Nolinor Aviation 737-400 to Val-d'Or (YVO)
10:08 - Nolinor Aviation 737-200 to Val-d'Or (YVO)
11:27 - Air France A220-300 to Montreal (YMX)
